page.title: 04HOUSING IN PERTH
page.content: S {Letham and Muirton}are large post- war council housing schemes of semi- detached and flatted accommodation. Letham's population is over 10,000 and it was found that 1.7% of households had no hot water tap, 3.5% no fixed bath, and 3% no inside lavatory. Local clusters of amenities have been provided in the form of shops, churches, dental and doctors' practices with better provision in the most recent 1970's development in North Muirton. {New estates}of privately owned timber frame houses and few amenities have spread south west at an alarming rate, encroaching on the surrounding farmland. In the Oakbank area 2 small shops serve an area of 2 square kilometres. The new by-passes to the south and west of the city may be the only barrier to this development.
